Test.name: Round trip time - single container
Test.WhatTest: Measures the average round trip time in communication between agents in the same container
Test.HowWorkTest: A "sender" agent sends an ACLMessage to a "receiver" agent, active in the same container, who replies with another ACLMessage. This process is repeated n times and the average value is computed. The number of couples sender-receiver can be configured to measure how the roud trip time varies when the number of active agents and exchanged messages increases.

Test.name: Round trip time - two containers
Test.WhatTest: Measures the average round trip time in communication between agents in two different containers belonging to the same platform and active on the same host
Test.HowWorkTest: A "sender" agent sends an ACLMessage to a "receiver" agent, active in a different container, who replies with another ACLMessage. This process is repeated n times and the average value is computed. The number of couples sender-receiver can be configured to measure how the roud trip time varies when the number of active agents and exchanged messages increases.

Test.name: Round trip time - two containers two hosts
Test.WhatTest:
Measures the average round trip time in communication between agents in two different containers belonging to the same platform and active on two different hosts.
NOTE: The Test suite remote daemon (test.common.remote.TSDaemon) must be active on another host for this test to succeed.
Test.HowWorkTest: A "sender" agent sends an ACLMessage to a "receiver" agent, active in a different container on a different host, who replies with another ACLMessage. This process is repeated n times and the average value is computed. The number of couples sender-receiver can be configured to measure how the roud trip time varies when the number of active agents and exchanged messages increases.

Test.name: Round trip time - two platforms IIOP
Test.WhatTest:
Measures the average round trip time in communication between agents in two different platforms running on two different hosts and communicating by means of the IIOP MTP.
NOTE: The Test suite remote daemon (test.common.remote.TSDaemon) must be active on another host for this test to succeed.
Test.HowWorkTest: A "sender" agent sends an ACLMessage to a "receiver" agent, active in a different platform, who replies with another ACLMessage. This process is repeated n times and the average value is computed. The number of couples sender-receiver can be configured to measure how the roud trip time varies when the number of active agents and exchanged messages increases.
